title: Zoro's Left Eye Training Handicap Theory
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Mihawk noticed Zoro suffers from ocular dominance in his left eye during their training. As a result, Mihawk deliberately scarred the left eye shut and instructed Zoro not to open it until his right eye was trained enough to overcome this weakness.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Zoro's eye is closed after training with Mihawk
Mihawk is known for brutal and effective training methods
Zoro's power increased significantly after the timeskip
counterEvidence: Could simply be a battle scar from training
Zoro has never mentioned any such instruction

title: Zoro's Sealed Power/Asura Eye Theory
theoryText: A popular fan theory suggests that Zoro's left eye is not actually lost but sealed, hiding a secret power or technique. Some believe the eye contains or controls Zoro's Asura demon power, and keeping it closed helps him maintain control over this dangerous ability until he needs to unleash it.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: The eye being closed rather than visibly damaged
Oda keeping the truth a secret suggests importance
counterEvidence: No canonical evidence of sealed powers
Zoro has used powerful techniques without opening the eye
Could be reading too much into a design choice

title: Yamato and Ace's 3D2Y Connection Theory
theoryText: This theory proposes that Yamato was able to decode Luffy's 3D2Y message because of a conversation with Ace about his ASCE tattoo (with the S crossed out). If Ace explained the meaning of his crossed-out 'S' tattoo to Yamato, it would give Yamato the context to understand Luffy's crossed-out '3D' message when combined with knowledge from Oden's journal.
author: 12Dimension WordPress Blog
evidence: Both Ace and Luffy used crossed-out tattoos as messages
Yamato met and befriended Ace on Onigashima
Yamato has access to Oden's journal with potential information
Yamato shows understanding of the Straw Hats' plans
counterEvidence: No confirmed conversation about Ace's tattoo
Yamato could have learned about 3D2Y through other means

title: Mihawk's Ultimate Test Theory
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Mihawk agreed to train Zoro not just because he recognized Zoro's loyalty to Luffy, but because he saw in Zoro the potential to finally surpass him. Mihawk, being the World's Greatest Swordsman, may have been looking for someone worthy to eventually take his title, and Zoro's selfless dedication proved he had the right spirit.
author: One Piece Fan Community
evidence: Mihawk's respect for Zoro since their first encounter
Mihawk specifically tested Zoro's resolve and motivation
The rarity of Mihawk taking on students
counterEvidence: Mihawk has never explicitly stated this intention
Mihawk could simply respect Zoro's loyalty
The theory is more interpretation than evidence-based
